intro: Diplycosia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, particularly Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It grows as an erect shrub or small tree, often found in moist, tropical forests. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are small, woody capsules that release seeds when mature.
